title: Help Refugees
subtitle: Behind ever number is a human story. With sadness, joy, hopes and dreams. With 70.8m forcibly displaced people worldwide, these are the highest levels of displacement ever recorded. No one chooses to become a refugee. But we can choose how we respond. Now and always, #chooselovepic.twitter.com/Mfe57ZyfWl

title: Safe Passage

title: UN Geneva
subtitle:
#TBT to the arrival of the first families from Europe's refugee camps to the United States on October 31, 1948. During the next two years the International Refugee Organization, direct predecessor of UNHCR, transported 205,000 displaced persons from Europe to the US.

title: Help Refugees
subtitle:
AWESOME to see @FlyingSeagullUK bringing joy and amazement to refugee children on Samos.
⁣
Life here can be unbearably hard, with overcrowding, fear and an uncertain future. 

Laugher, smiles and mind-blowing acrobatics make such a change to harsh refugee camp life. #chooselovepic.twitter.com/XakR4MWKVD

title: Børge Brende
subtitle: I am deeply saddened to hear of the passing of former UN High Commissioner for Refugees Sadako Ogata — a true friend and mentor.
